subject: Creativity
title: Convergent Thinking: Choosing the Best Idea
description: A fast breakdown of Convergent Thinking: Choosing the Best Idea for builders.

hook.text: Having 200 ideas is useless if you can't pick the right one. Convergent thinking narrows the field.

buildup.text: While divergent thinking expands possibilities, convergent thinking evaluates, filters, and selects the best.

discovery.text: Creative people aren't just idea machines. They alternate between diverging (generating) and converging (selecting).

twist.text: Most brainstorming fails because teams try to diverge and converge simultaneously â€” judging ideas while generating them.

climax.text: The Double Diamond model separates these: first diamond diverges then converges on the problem; second does the same.

punchline.text: Creativity needs two muscles: one to open wide, one to close tight.

quiz.question: Why does most brainstorming fail according to creativity research?
